devdoc.author: 1inch Network
devdoc.details: This contract uses 128-bit (16 bytes) Merkle tree nodes for gas optimization and requires signature verification for claims. Each claim can only be made once, tracked via a bitmap for gas efficiency.

FailedCall().details: A call to an address target failed. The target may have reverted.

InsufficientBalance(uint256,uint256).details: The ETH balance of the account is not enough to perform the operation.

OwnableInvalidOwner(address).details: The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)

OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address).details: The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation.

claim(address,uint256,bytes,bytes).details: The signature must be from the account that is part of the Merkle tree. Includes gas cashback functionality if ETH is sent with the transaction.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to claim
params.merkleProof: The Merkle proof verifying the claim (must be a multiple of 16 bytes)
params.receiver: The address that will receive the tokens
params.signature: The signature from the account authorized in the Merkle tree

params.depth_: The depth of the Merkle tree
params.merkleRoot_: The 128-bit Merkle root of the distribution
params.token_: The address of the ERC20 token to be distributed

params.index: The index in the Merkle tree to check

returns._0: True if the claim has been made, false otherwise

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

rescueFunds(address,uint256).details: Only callable by the contract owner

params.token_: The token address to rescue (use address(0) for ETH)

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params.proof: The Merkle proof to verify (must be a multiple of 16 bytes)

returns.index: The index of the leaf in the Merkle tree
returns.valid: True if the proof is valid, false otherwise

params.proof: The Merkle proof to verify (must be a multiple of 16 bytes)
params.root: The 128-bit Merkle root to verify against

returns.index: The index of the leaf in the Merkle tree
returns.valid: True if the proof is valid, false otherwise

devdoc.title: SignatureMerkleDrop128

claim(address,uint256,bytes,bytes).notice: Claims tokens for a receiver using a Merkle proof and signature

depth().notice: The depth of the Merkle tree

isClaimed(uint256).notice: Checks if a claim at a specific index has already been made

merkleRoot().notice: The 128-bit Merkle root for the distribution

rescueFunds(address,uint256).notice: Allows owner to rescue stuck funds (ETH or ERC20 tokens)

verify(bytes,bytes16).notice: Verifies a Merkle proof against the contract's merkleRoot

verify(bytes,bytes16,bytes16).notice: Verifies a Merkle proof against a specified root

userdoc.notice: A gas-optimized contract for distributing tokens via 128-bit Merkle tree proofs with signature verification
